page.title: 10THE GASCOIGNE ESTATE
page.content: This housing estate was named after a local family who owned land here. It is a large housing development built in the 1960s to replace poor housing. Most of the buildings are 3-storeys, but there are three 17-storey tower blocks and five 12-storey blocks. St. Ann's has 228 flats. Garage blocks were built but they are being taken down now because of vandals and glue-sniffers. Cars are parked in the streets or on the grass. There is a primary school on the estate and a shopping centre with eight shops, plus a concrete playground and a tiny grass playing space. There is a day centre for old people nearby and a pub called 'The Hope'.
